intro: Asclepiodora viridis var. angustior, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features slender, angular stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped, typically with a waxy coating, and are arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by follicles containing toxic, milky sap. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value.
